example-trap5.cpp

An additional example of the objective function. Here a concatenated trap of order 5 is used, which is fully deceptive. This function can be used for binary strings where the number of bits is an integer multiple of 5. This function should not be used for non-binary representations.

00001 double objective_function(int *x, int n)
00002 {
00003   int val=0;
00004 
00005   // verify the string length constraint
00006 
00007   if (n%5!=0)
00008     {
00009       printf("Trap function requires string length divisible by 5.\n");
00010       exit(-55);
00011     }
00012         
00013   // add up all the traps
00014 
00015   for (int i=0; i<n;)
00016     {
00017       int sum=0;
00018 
00019       // compute the sum of bits in the next 5 bits
00020 
00021       for (int k=0; k<5; k++)
00022         sum+=x[i++];
00023       
00024       // compute the trap-5 value for the computed sum
00025 
00026       if (sum==5)
00027         val+=5;
00028       else
00029         val+=4-sum;
00030     }
00031 
00032   // return the result
00033   
00034   return val;
00035 }
